fields.Title of Contribution: BENEFITS, CHALLENGES, AND STRATEGIES FOR INCREASING WOMENCOACHES IN ELITE SPORT: THE TRAIL TO GOLD (T2G) INITIATIVE IN U.S.CROSS-COUNTRY SKIING
fields.Journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
fields.Description/Abstract: Despite tremendous growth in sport participation of girls and women following Title IX in<br>1972, women’s participation as sport coaches did not follow the same trajectory. In fact,<br>women remain significantly underrepresented in sport coaching. Research highlights ongoing<br>barriers within the sport industry's patriarchal structure, and although strategies have been<br>proposed to improve women’s representation, the lack of progress over the past two decades<br>indicates limited effectiveness. A better approach is essential to address this issue across<br>individual, interpersonal, organizational, and societal levels. The purpose of this study is to<br>interview participants within the U.S. cross-country skiing program, Trail to Gold (T2G), to<br>learn about its programming and implementation, with an eye toward learning from this<br>comprehensive, multidimensional approach to help advance women coaches in all elite<br>sports. Eight coaches and administrators who participated in the T2G program completed<br>semi-structured interviews. Interviews were transcribed verbatim and reviewed by<br>participants for accuracy. Key themes were identified using both inductive and deductive<br>qualitative analysis methods, with final themes confirmed by triangulation. T2G participants<br>highlighted the importance of a supportive environment, robust networking, and effective<br>sponsorship to advance women in coaching roles. This study expands the recommended<br>strategies to increase women’s representation in sports coaching by learning from women<br>coaches and administrators who work in environments that value and actively pursue gender<br>parity. Continued support for women coaches is essential for gender equality, enhanced team<br>performance, and a more inclusive sporting environment.
